intro: Cyrtandra personata, commonly known as the Hawaiian bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue-violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a waxy texture. Cyrtandra personata is an important component of Hawaii's native flora and is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of the archipelago.
